title: Bore (engine)
text:
In a <a href="reciprocating%20engine">piston engine</a>, the bore (or cylinder bore) is the diameter of each <a href="cylinder%20%28engine%29">cylinder</a>.
<a href="Engine%20displacement">Engine displacement</a> is calculated based on bore, <a href="Stroke%20%28engine%29%23Stroke%20length">stroke length</a> and the number of cylinders: 
 displacement = 
The <a href="stroke%20ratio">stroke ratio</a>, determined by dividing the bore by the stroke, traditionally indicated whether an engine was designed for power at high engine speeds (<a href="Revolutions%20per%20minute">rpm</a>) or <a href="torque">torque</a> at lower engine speeds. The term "bore" can also be applied to the bore of a <a href="Cylinder%20%28locomotive%29">locomotive cylinder</a> or <a href="steam%20engine%23Piston%20steam%20engines">steam engine pistons</a>.
Steam locomotive.
The term bore also applies to the <a href="Cylinder%20%28locomotive%29">cylinder</a> of a <a href="steam%20locomotive">steam locomotive</a> or <a href="steam%20engine">steam engine</a>.
